title: Shadowban Scanner for Twitter / X
description: The official site for the Shadowban Scanner extension, which detects shadowbans and sensitive content flags on Twitter (X).
subheadline: Shadowban Scanner is a browser extension that detects shadowbans and sensitive content flags on X without the need to visit external websites.
detectAccountsShadowbanAndSensitiveFlags: Detect account shadowbans and sensitive content flags
Check if a Twitter account is shadowbanned or flagged as sensitive. You can check both your account and other people's accounts.
detectTweetsSensitiveFlagsAndAgeRestrict: Detect sensitive content flags and age restrictions on tweets
Check if tweets are flagged as sensitive or have age restrictions.
detectSensitiveFlagsInProfileMedia: Detect sensitive content flags in profile media
detectSensitiveFlagsInProfileMediaDescri: Verify if your Twitter profile media is flagged as sensitive.
detectCountriesBlockingYourAccountDescri: Some countries may block accounts for legal reasons. Check if any countries are blocking your account and identify which ones.
addButtonToShowHiddenTweets: Add buttons to show hidden tweets
addButtonToShowHiddenTweetsDescription: On Twitter, some tweets containing external links may be hidden. This feature adds buttons to reveal those hidden tweets.
noAccessToExternalWebsitesDescription: Shadowban Scanner displays results directly on your tweets and profile. There is no need to visit external websites. It also does not access external servers or Twitter's internal APIs, protecting your privacy and data.
openSourceDescription: The source code is available on GitHub. All features are completely free to use.
supportedBrowsers: Shadowban Scanner supports Chrome, Edge, and Firefox.
isShadowbanScannerFreeAnswer: Yes, all features of Shadowban Scanner are completely free to use.
whyIsShadowbanScannerFreeAnswer: Shadowban Scanner is a project developed as a hobby by the author and is provided for free. However, development and operation take a lot of time, so if you can afford it, please consider supporting me through Buy Me a Coffee or GitHub Sponsors.
areThereWaysToSupportDevelopment: Are there ways to support the development of Shadowban Scanner?
areThereWaysToSupportDevelopmentAnswer1: Yes, you can support development through Buy Me a Coffee or GitHub Sponsors. Even simply following the author's Twitter account is a great encouragement for development.
areThereWaysToSupportDevelopmentAnswer2: If you are familiar with programming or would like to help with the translation of Shadowban Scanner, you can participate in development on GitHub.
howAccurateIsShadowbanScannerAnswer1: For account-level shadowban detection, like many other tools, false positives and false negatives can occur. However, it can detect tweet-level sensitive flags and age restrictions almost perfectly.
howAccurateIsShadowbanScannerAnswer2: I recommend using Shadowban Scanner to continuously check the status of your account and tweets, while also using other tools.
doesShadowbanScannerTransmitUserDataExte: Does Shadowban Scanner transmit user data externally?
No, the regular version (extension version) of Shadowban Scanner does not transmit user data externally. All processing is completed within the user's web browser.
doINeedAnAccountForShadowbanScanner: Do I need an account to use Shadowban Scanner?
doINeedAnAccountForShadowbanScannerAnswe: No, you do not need to create an account to use Shadowban Scanner itself. However, you will need a Twitter account to browse Twitter.
howDoesShadowbanScannerEnsureSafety: How does Shadowban Scanner ensure safety?
howDoesShadowbanScannerEnsureSafetyAnswe: Shadowban Scanner is open source and its source code is publicly available, allowing anyone to review it. In addition, I am making various efforts to ensure user safety. For more details, please refer to "Shadowban Scanner's commitment to safety (Japanese)".
isTheSourceCodePubliclyAvailable: Is the source code for Shadowban Scanner publicly available?
isTheSourceCodePubliclyAvailableAnswer: Yes, all of Shadowban Scanner's source code is publicly available on GitHub.
smartphonesAreNotSupportedDescription: For technical reasons, Shadowban Scanner is only available for PC browsers, Android Firefox and Android Kiwi Browser.
